exercises.question: Translate to German: The dog is loud. (dog is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: She sees the dog. (dog is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The woman is tall. (woman is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: He likes the woman. (woman is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The book is new. (book is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: I read the book. (book is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The car is fast. (car is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: We see the car. (car is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The man is nice. (man is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: You meet the man. (man is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The cat is small. (cat is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: He feeds the cat. (cat is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The child is happy. (child is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: She hugs the child. (child is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The apple is red. (apple is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: I eat the apple. (apple is maskulin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The lamp is bright. (lamp is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: He switches on the lamp. (lamp is feminin in Deutsch)
Translate to German: The bread is fresh. (bread is neutral in Deutsch)
Translate to German: We buy the bread. (bread is neutral in Deutsch)
